channel.title: The Amazon Cloud now offering free VPS for one year
channel.description:
Why has the Amazon cloud dominated Microsoft Azure in the VPS marketplace?
http://www.cnbc.com/id/102285758#.
Amazon has had a head-start, and I believe their platform is more accessible and intuitive. They have really zeroed in on the small and medium sized businesses who don't want to deal with a physical server but require web services for a decent price.
I've made a video showing how to setup a basic website using amazon cloud, check it out if you want help getting started.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Jw_L9CXN1o&feature=youtu.be
Merry Christmas! :D

item.title: The Amazon Cloud now offering free VPS for one year
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Loveandpower:

but what is the price afterwards?

It’s pretty expensive. It’s an “Elastic Compute Cloud” so it dynamically assigns resources to your server instance, and this is pricey. You will want to check the limitations of the “Free hosting” deal, of n course; you can get a bit of free hosting and learn the platform, but if you wanted a permenant hosting solution, you would want to sign up for a long term plan to save money.

Read full topic
item.source: The Amazon Cloud now offering free VPS for one year
